text: DANA BASH: At a recent

the LAPD Chief Charlie
Beck said there's actually

been a 25% drop in reports of
rape among the city's Latino

population since the
beginning of 2017

and a 10% drop in reports
of domestic violence,

with no such similar
drops among other groups.
Listen to what the chief said.

CHARLIE BECK: Imagine
a young woman--

imagine your daughter,
your sister, your mother,

your friend not reporting
a sexual assault

because they are afraid
that their family
will be torn apart by doing so.

DANA BASH: Mr. Secretary he is
arguing that your "get tough"

policy is making people
less safe, rather.
What's your response?

JOHN KELLY: Well,
certainly the police
chief is a hero in my mind.

I mean, he's where,
obviously, the-- locally,
where the rubber meets the road.
But he's got his job to do.
I've got my job to do.

And as I've said repeatedly,
Dana, the illegal aliens

that we're going after
are not, if you will,
simply here illegally.

We're actually going
after the very people

that the sheriff references in
terms of criminals that happen
to be here also illegally.

And I would just highlight
the fact that you can report
crimes and not give your name.

I mean, the 911 process is
anonymous if you want it to be.

But again, I don't
have facts and figures.
I haven't looked at it.

I hear this a lot, that the
reports are down and all that.

I would just, again, tell the
illegal immigrant community,

if you are simply
here illegally,

we don't really have the
time to go after you.

We're looking for
bad men and women.

And we're doing that
very, very effectively.

DANA BASH: I just
want to be clear.

You are using this forum to
send a message to women who

are raped, other
people who are abused,

victims of domestic
violence that they

should still feel
comfortable to come
forward and report that crime?

JOHN KELLY: I think it's
their duty to do that.

But yes, they should feel
comfortable doing it.

DANA BASH: Without fear
of getting deported?

JOHN KELLY: We are not going
after people who are victims--
we are not going--

well, I would say that if
they're also criminals,
that's a different story.

But if they're
simply here illegally

and are the victim
of a crime, then
they should report that crime.
